Copies a file

operations.description:
Copies the file at the sourcePath into the targetPath.

If targetPath doesn't exist, and neither does its parent, then an attempt will be made to create depending on the value of the createParentFolder argument. If such argument is , then a FILE:ILLEGAL_PATH will be thrown.

If the target file already exists, then it will be overwritten if the overwrite argument is true. Otherwise, FILE:FILE_ALREADY_EXISTS error will be thrown.

As for the sourcePath, it can either be a file or a directory. If it points to a directory, then it will be copied recursively.

parameters.description: the path to the file to be copied
parameters.name: sourcePath

parameters.description: the target directory where the file is going to be copied
parameters.name: targetPath

parameters.description: whether or not to attempt creating any parent directories which don't exists.
parameters.name: createParentDirectories

parameters.description: whether or not overwrite the file if the target destination already exists.
parameters.name: overwrite

parameters.description: copied file's new name. If not provided, original file name will be kept.
parameters.name: renameTo

parameters.description: The name of the configuration to be used to execute this component
parameters.name: config-ref

parameters.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

description.value: How often (in ms) to reconnect
If false, the reconnection strategy will run in a separate, non-blocking thread
How many reconnection attempts to make
How often (in ms) to reconnect
If false, the reconnection strategy will run in a separate, non-blocking thread

parameters.name: reconnectionStrategy

parameters.description: wait time between size checks to determine if a file is ready to be read.

parameters.description: The name of the configuration to be used to execute this component
parameters.name: config-ref

parameters.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

description.value: This is the amount of instances that will be initially be allowed to be kept in memory in order to consume the stream and provide random access to it. If the stream contains more data than can fit into this buffer, then it will be expanded according to the bufferSizeIncrement attribute, with an upper limit of maxInMemorySize. Default value is 100 instances.

This is by how much will the buffer size by expanded if it exceeds its initial size. Setting a value of zero or lower will mean that the buffer should not expand, meaning that a STREAM_MAXIMUM_SIZE_EXCEEDED error will be raised when the buffer gets full. Default value is 100 instances.
This is the maximum amount of memory that will be used. If more than that is used then a STREAM_MAXIMUM_SIZE_EXCEEDED error will be raised. A value lower or equal to zero means no limit.
This is the maximum amount of instances that will be kept in memory. If more than that is required, then it will start to buffer the content on disk.
The unit in which maxInMemorySize is expressed

This configuration allows the stream to be read only once. It will not allow to seek randomly which will limit the transformations that DW can perform on this stream. Use this option for use cases which just require moving data around from one system to another to get optimum performance.

parameters.name: streamingStrategy

parameters.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed
parameters.name: target

parameters.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable
parameters.name: targetValue

If false, the reconnection strategy will run in a separate, non-blocking thread

displayModel.summary: Obtains the content and metadata of a file at a given path

operations.description:
Obtains the content and metadata of a file at a given path. The operation itself returns a Message which payload is a InputStream with the file's content, and the metadata is represent as a LocalFileAttributes object that's placed as the message Message#getAttributes() attributes.

If the lock parameter is set to true, then a file system level lock will be placed on the file until the input stream this operation returns is closed or fully consumed. Because the lock is actually provided by the host file system, its behavior might change depending on the mounted drive and the operation system on which mule is running. Take that into consideration before blindly relying on this lock.

This method also makes a best effort to determine the mime type of the file being read. The file's extension will be used to make an educated guess on the file's mime type. The user also has the chance to force the output encoding and mimeType through the outputEncoding and outputMimeType optional parameters.

parameters.description: the path to the file to be read
parameters.name: path

parameters.description: whether or not to lock the file. Defaults to false.
parameters.name: lock

parameters.description: wait time between size checks to determine if a file is ready to be read.
parameters.name: timeBetweenSizeCheck

parameters.description: time unit to be used in the wait time between size checks.
parameters.name: timeBetweenSizeCheckUnit

parameters.description: The mime type of the payload that this operation outputs.
parameters.name: outputMimeType

parameters.description: The encoding of the payload that this operation outputs.
parameters.name: outputEncoding

parameters.description: The name of the configuration to be used to execute this component
parameters.name: config-ref

This is by how much will be buffer size by expanded if it exceeds its initial size. Setting a value of zero or lower will mean that the buffer should not expand, meaning that a STREAM_MAXIMUM_SIZE_EXCEEDED error will be raised when the buffer gets full.
This is the maximum amount of memory that will be used. If more than that is used then a STREAM_MAXIMUM_SIZE_EXCEEDED error will be raised. A value lower or equal to zero means no limit.
The unit in which all these attributes are expressed
Defines the maximum memory that the stream should use to keep data in memory. If more than that is consumed then it will start to buffer the content on disk.
The unit in which maxInMemorySize is expressed

This configuration allows the input stream to be read only once. It will not allow to seek randomly which will limit the transformations that DW can perform on this stream. Use this option for use cases which just require moving data around from one system to another to get optimum performance.

displayModel.summary: Writes the given "Content" in the file pointed by "Path"

operations.description:
Writes the content into the file pointed by path.

If the directory on which the file is attempting to be written doesn't exist, then the operation will either throw FILE:ILLEGAL_PATH error or create such folder depending on the value of the createParentDirectory.

If the file itself already exists, then the behavior depends on the supplied mode.

This operation also supports locking support depending on the value of the lock argument, but following the same rules and considerations as described in the read operation.

parameters.description: the path of the file to be written
parameters.name: path

displayModel.summary: Content to be written into the file

parameters.description: the content to be written into the file. Defaults to the current Message payload

displayModel.summary: Triggers when a new file is created in a directory

parameters.name: autoDelete

parameters.description: If provided, each processed file will be moved to a directory pointed by this path.
parameters.name: moveToDirectory

parameters.description: This parameter works in tandem with moveToDirectory. Use this parameter to enter the name under which the file should be moved. Do not set this parameter if moveToDirectory hasn't been set as well.
parameters.name: renameTo

parameters.description: Whether any of the post actions (autoDelete and moveToDirectory) should also be applied in case the file failed to be processed. If set to false, no failed files will be moved nor deleted.
parameters.name: applyPostActionWhenFailed

messageSources.description:
Polls a directory looking for files that have been created or updated. One message will be generated for each file that is found.

The key part of this functionality is how to determine that a file is actually new. There're three strategies for that:

  • Set the autoDelete parameter to true: This will delete each processed file after it has been processed, causing all files obtained in the next poll to be necessarily new
  • Set moveToDirectory parameter: This will move each processed file to a different directory after it has been processed, achieving the same effect as autoDelete but without loosing the file
  • Use the watermarkMode parameter to only pick files that have been created/updated after the last poll was executed.

A matcher can also be used for additional filtering of files.

parameters.description: The directory on which polled files are contained
parameters.name: directory

displayModel.summary: Whether or not to also catch files created on sub directories

parameters.description: Whether or not to also files contained in sub directories.
parameters.name: recursive

parameters.description: A matcher used to filter events on files which do not meet the matcher's criteria
parameters.name: matcher

parameters.description: Controls whether or not to do watermarking, and if so, if the watermark should consider the file's modification or creation timestamps
parameters.name: watermarkMode

displayModel.summary: Wait time in milliseconds between size checks to determine if a file is ready to be read.

parameters.description: Wait time in milliseconds between size checks to determine if a file is ready to be read. This allows a file write to complete before processing. You can disable this feature by omitting a value. When enabled, Mule performs two size checks waiting the specified time between calls. If both checks return the same value, the file is ready to be read.
parameters.name: timeBetweenSizeCheck

displayModel.summary: Time unit to be used in the wait time between size checks

parameters.description: A TimeUnit which qualifies the #timeBetweenSizeCheck attribute.
parameters.name: timeBetweenSizeCheckUnit

This is the maximum amount of memory that will be used. If more than that is used then a STREAM_MAXIMUM_SIZE_EXCEEDED error will be raised. A value lower or equal to zero means no limit.
